extracted_data_phrases: from staying away from Sacraments or Mass by your words ,

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.question: Did I permit my grandchild to be exposed to bad influences?

condoning.question: Did I remain silent when another Catholic, perhaps someone dear to me, expressed plans for marrying outside the Church?

oppression.question: Have I intentionally or unintentionally mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others through my deeds?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my leisurely pursuits, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: in guiding you through various trials and blessings
autonomy.question: Did you take for granted your comfortable life circumstances, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding you through various trials and blessings?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I envied others' blessings and secretly wished they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I coveted others' blessings, wishing they would be taken away from them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in using words to offend others
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in using words to offend others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that was unbecoming and disrespectful
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others in a manner that was unbecoming and disrespectful, causing them offense and hurting their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did you indulge in excessive eating or drinking, especially when alone or at social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you allow excessive eating or drinking to lead you away from a moderate lifestyle, especially in your leisure activities?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful indulgence in leisure activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in spreading rumors or discussing others ' private lives
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in spreading rumors or discussing others' private lives, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' private affairs, even if what I said was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in conversations that reveal confidential information about others
gossip.question: Have I indulged in conversations that reveal confidential information about others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday that could have been avoided
impiety.question: Did I engage in productive activities on a Sunday that could have been avoided, thus disregarding it as a day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeking understanding and reconciliation
anger.question: Have I nursed anger against someone, rather than seeking understanding and reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
